devil_mark.description: cross blackened on the inside, containing blessed alba and vine branches, placed by a priest (Messire Claude Pierel, curé de Saincte Margarée)

testimony.quarrel_subject: bull ran after cow of accused and entered her house
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il se taise et que le diable luy cuisoit une souppe
que sy on la prenoit, elle en feroit prendre des aultres

testimony.quarrel_subject: horse which had strayed into her field

testimony.threat_quote: Vielle sorciere, qu'est ce que tu dis, il n'y a guieres que ton marit a esté bruslé et sy fauldra encor qu'on te menne avec luy

testimony.quarrel_subject: refused marriage proposal from Pierron d'Orbay for her daughter
testimony.threat_quote: she would repent for not giving daughter to Pierron

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Catherine veuve Jean Diez and/or Pierron d'Orbay

testimony.quarrel_subject: overheard quarrel with Georgeatte femme Claudon Prevost
testimony.threat_quote: if she was arrested she would have Georgeatte arrested too

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: languished from St George to St Luke (approximately 6 months)

testimony.threat_quote: if she was arrested she would have Jean Mengin's wife arrested too

timeline.subject: Catherine veuve Jean Diez
timeline.details: Denied accusations, claimed cross on finger protected her from devil

timeline.subject: Catherine veuve Jean Diez
timeline.details: Change de Nancy ruled she may be tortured if Mengeatte femme Lallemand persists with accusation, otherwise only shown instruments

torture.restrictions: May be tortured only if Mengeatte femme Lallemand persists with accusation, otherwise should only be shown instruments

prior_accusations.context: Recently accused by the hospitaliere, but she later withdrew her accusation saying she made it to avenge herself because she had been accused by Jean Diez

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine veuve Jean Diez (accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il se taise et que le diable luy cuisoit une souppe
notable_quotes.english: that he should be quiet and the devil was cooking him a soup
notable_quotes.context: Alleged threat to Jean François before his death by thunderbolt

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine veuve Jean Diez (accused)
notable_quotes.french: que sy on la prenoit, elle en feroit prendre des aultres
notable_quotes.english: that if she was arrested, she would cause others to be arrested
notable_quotes.context: Threat when rumor of her arrest circulated

notable_quotes.speaker: Toussainct Guillemotte (witness 7) to accused
notable_quotes.context: After his pig escaped into her garden

notable_quotes.speaker: Toussainct Guillemotte (witness 7)
notable_quotes.french: Vielle sorciere, qu'est ce que tu dis, il n'y a guieres que ton marit a esté bruslé et sy fauldra encor qu'on te menne avec luy
notable_quotes.english: Old witch, what are you saying, it's not long since your husband was burned and they will have to take you with him
notable_quotes.context: Response to accused calling him 'grand cocquin'

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine veuve Jean Diez (accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'aultant en pendoit à l'oeil a tous les aultres
notable_quotes.english: that the same hung over the eyes of all the others
notable_quotes.context: When people spoke of having her arrested

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine veuve Jean Diez (accused)
notable_quotes.french: travaillant ordinairement pour gaigner sa pauvre vie
notable_quotes.english: ordinarily working to earn her poor living

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine veuve Jean Diez (accused)
notable_quotes.french: quant à elle, jamais elle ne print garde sur les malefices de son marit, aultrement estoient de bon accord
notable_quotes.english: as for her, she never paid attention to her husband's malefices, otherwise they were in good accord
notable_quotes.context: About her late husband during interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine veuve Jean Diez (accused)
notable_quotes.french: Que c'est simplesse de luy parler de telle chose, qu'elle at en ung doigt, au dessus, enfermé de lealbe beniste et des pampies et que ce fit ung prebtre, Messire Claude Pierel, luy vivant curé de Saincte Margarée, par le moyen dequoy, elle est conservée, et ne peult estre abusée ne tentée du malin esprit
notable_quotes.english: That it is foolishness to speak to her of such things, that she has in a finger, above, enclosed blessed alba and vine branches that a priest made, Messire Claude Pierel, the late curé of Saincte Margarée, by means of which she is preserved and cannot be abused or tempted by the evil spirit
notable_quotes.context: Defense during interrogation about the cross on her finger

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine veuve Jean Diez (accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il est impossible, Qu'il n'y ait des gens dampnés de faire contre elle, ce que faisons, Que sy dieu venoit maintenant luy dire, Que sy elle n'est sorciere, elle precipite en soy, ung cousteau, et qu'il ne luy feroit mol mal, elle en feroit aussy tost, asseurée comme elle est de son innocence et prudhommie
notable_quotes.english: that it is impossible that there are not damned people to do against her what we are doing, that if God came now to tell her that if she is not a witch, she should plunge a knife into herself and it would do her no harm, she would do it at once, assured as she is of her innocence and honesty

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Diez (husband) to Toussaint Fresse
notable_quotes.french: que s'il est esté a la maison alors, ce n'eut esté tout ung
notable_quotes.english: that if he had been at home then, it would not have been all one
notable_quotes.context: Response when asked if he had struck the bull

relationships.evidence_text: Catherine veuve Jean Diez - widow of Jean Diez
Story of death of her first husband Jean François
her daughter who died after refusing Pierron d'Orbay
Jehennon femme Toussainct Guillemette - likely wife of witness 7 Toussainct Guillemotte

economic_context.details: Toussainct Guillematte and accused quarrelled over small sum of money she asked him to repay. Accused described herself as 'travaillant ordinairement pour gaigner sa pauvre vie' (ordinarily working to earn her poor living). Property confiscated and sold for only 13 francs after conviction, indicating very poor economic status.

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused told him 'qu'il se taise et que le diable luy cuisoit une souppe'

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill after entering house of accused
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: bull ran after cow of accused and entered her house

harms_catalog.harm_description: broke its leg in the stable
fell into river from damaged 'rux' and nearly drowned
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: he and husband bought meat together, shared it in accused's house, she gave him something to carry it
pig escaped into her garden, exchange of insults

harms_catalog.victim_name: daughter of Mengeatte femme Demenge Mourel
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Catherine veuve Jean Diez and/or Pierron d'Orbay

harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 2 weeks after attending Christmas betrothal ceremony of Pierron to another girl
languished from St George (April 23) to St Luke (October 18) - approximately 6 months

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Jehennon femme Toussainct Guillemette
harms_catalog.harm_description: illness, possibly dried up from oatmeal bread
harms_catalog.method_alleged: caused illness then cured it by rubbing leg from knee to foot

material_culture.context: accused suggested it might have dried up sick child
child had not eaten wheaten or oatmeal bread for long time
accused came asking for some salt around time of Lent
Jean Mengin and husband bought meat together and shared it in accused's house
enclosed in finger by priest Messire Claude Pierel for protection from evil spirit
on accused's finger, judges called it a sign of devil's abuse

weather_events: thunderbolt killed Jean François 12 years before trial
economic_hardship_indicators: accused described herself as 'working ordinarily to earn her poor living'
quarrel over small sum of money
child had not eaten wheaten or oatmeal bread for long time (food scarcity)
accused came asking for salt (basic food insecurity)

change_de_nancy.modification_details: May be tortured if Mengeatte femme Lallemand persists with her accusation, otherwise should only be shown the instruments

hearsay_chains.content: Later heard that accused had told Jean François 'qu'il se taise et que le diable luy cuisoit une souppe'
Had heard her say that if she was arrested she would cause others to be
After execution of husband heard accused quarrelling with Georgeatte femme Claudon Prevost
Had heard her tell Jean Mengin's wife that if she was arrested she would have her arrested too

emotional_state_notes: became silent after judges rebuked her about the cross, claiming they would not believe her
protested innocence dramatically, saying she would plunge a knife into herself if God told her to prove innocence

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said Toussainct Guillematte had called her witch, and she did same to him when they quarrelled over small sum of money
Claimed her husband had been responsible for broken leg of Jean Mengin's horse

third_parties.name: Jean François
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: first husband of witness 8 (Georgeatte femme Claudon Prevost), person witness 2 (Toussaint Fresse) was helping
third_parties.context: Killed by thunderbolt 12 years before trial, allegedly after threat from accused

third_parties.name: Jean Diez
third_parties.context: Husband of accused, arrested and executed as witch before this trial, also had long reputation as witch

third_parties.name: Claudatte Haulterolbe
third_parties.context: Had already accused Catherine before this trial

third_parties.name: l'Hospitaliere du Viel Marché
third_parties.context: Recently accused Catherine but later withdrew accusation, saying she made it to avenge herself because she had been accused by Jean Diez

third_parties.name: Mengeatte femme Lallemand
third_parties.context: Change de Nancy ruling mentions torture depends on whether this person persists with her accusation

third_parties.name: Messire Claude Pierel
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: priest who gave her protective cross
third_parties.context: Late curé of Saincte Margarée who placed blessed alba and vine branches in accused's finger for protection from evil spirit

third_parties.name: Pierron d'Orbay
third_parties.context: Wanted to marry daughter of witness 9, was refused, daughter died after he was betrothed to another girl. Also had reputation as witch.

third_parties.name: Claudon Prevost
third_parties.context: Husband of Georgeatte femme Claudon Prevost

third_parties.name: Anthoine Alezey
third_parties.context: Quarrelled with accused 9 years before, then languished and died from St George to St Luke

third_parties.name: Mengeon Gillat
third_parties.context: Husband of Zabel femme Mengeon Gillat

third_parties.name: daughter of Mengeatte femme Demenge Mourel
third_parties.context: Refused marriage to Pierron d'Orbay, died 2 weeks after attending his betrothal ceremony to another girl

third_parties.name: child of Toussainct Guillemotte
third_parties.context: Fell ill same hour as quarrel between accused and father, recovered after accused rubbed leg around time of Lent

third_parties.name: child of Jehennon femme Toussainct Guillemette
third_parties.context: Was sick, accused visited and rubbed leg from knee to foot, then recovered. Witness believed accused caused illness then cured it

third_parties.name: Jean Mengin's wife
third_parties.context: Accused allegedly threatened to have her arrested too

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a well-documented trial with clear testimony from 13 witnesses. The accused Catherine was widow of Jean Diez who had already been executed as a witch. Key features: (1) Multiple healing incidents where accused appeared to cure after causing illness by touching/rubbing children's legs - strong evidence of healing practice. (2) Unusual defense: accused showed cross on finger placed by priest with blessed alba and vine branches, claiming it protected her from devil - judges interpreted this as devil's mark. (3) Economic status clearly poor based on self-description 'working to earn poor living' and property sale of only 13 francs. (4) Pattern of threats to implicate others if arrested (reported by multiple witnesses). (5) Change de Nancy conditional approval of torture dependent on whether Mengeatte femme Lallemand persisted with accusation. (6) No formal confession recorded, but conviction inferred from property confiscation. (7) Retracted accusation from l'Hospitaliere du Viel Marché who admitted making it for revenge. (8) Multiple deaths attributed to accused including thunderbolt deaths (unusual). (9) Economic disputes over small debts mentioned. Uncertain: Final outcome listed as 'death' is inferred from property confiscation but no execution record in document. Note on witness 12 name: 'Guillemette' vs witness 7 'Guillemotte' - likely same family name variation, assumed to be wife of witness 7 but listed as inferred relationship.
